data.title: Bavarian Nordic secures EU contract for up to 8 million smallpox/mpox vaccine doses to enhance preparedness.
data.description: In Copenhagen, Denmark on October 31, 2025, Bavarian Nordic A/S (OMX: BAVA) revealed it had secured a collective procurement deal from the European Commission via the Health Emergency Preparedness and Response Authority (HERA). This contract allows the EU, its member nations, and other European countries 1 to acquire a maximum of 8 million doses of Bavarian Nordic A/S's MVA-BN® smallpox/mpox vaccine.

data.title: BofA CEO warns of economic malaise amid prolonged shutdown, recession risk increasing, stock market unaffected.
data.description: Bank of America Corp. CEO, Brian Moynihan, and Moody's Analytics Chief Economist, Mark Zandi, warn that the U.S. economy is being significantly harmed by the ongoing government shutdown. Moynihan cautions that the impasse could lead to an economic "malaise" as essential government functions have been halted, impacting businesses. If the shutdown persists through the end of the year, Zandi believes a recession is "more likely than not." Moynihan highlights the adverse effects on government employees and private sector businesses, with 250,000 to 300,000 of BofA's customers impacted by the situation. The original belief that the shutdown would have minimal impact is fading, and the uncertainty may cause consumers to reduce spending and employers to cut jobs.
ECB's Kazaks: Risks to growth and inflation are more balanced.

data.title: Ultima Markets and Inter deepen partnership in Milan, celebrating Regional Partnership for Asian territory, transitioning from online to real world.
data.description: On October 31, 2025, Ultima Markets announced a new Regional Partnership for the Asian region with FC Internazionale Milano (Inter) in Milan. This collaboration marks a significant step as the two entities transitioned from an online connection to a physical presence in Milan. Passion, performance, and purpose converged as they solidified their partnership, enhancing opportunities in the Asian market.

data.title: Charter Communications expected to report higher Q3 earnings, with analysts forecasting $9.29 per share, lower revenue at $13.75B.
data.description: Charter Communications, Inc. (NASDAQ: CHTR) is set to announce its third-quarter earnings before markets open on Friday, Oct. 31. Analysts predict the Connecticut-based company will post earnings of $9.29 per share, up from $8.82 per share a year ago. Revenue for the quarter is expected to be around $13.75 billion, slightly less than the $13.79 billion reported in the previous year. In the second quarter, Charter Communications saw a 0.6% revenue growth, surpassing projections at $13.77 billion. Following this news, the company's stock price dropped by 4.4%, closing at $230.92 on Thursday. For more detailed information, including analyst ratings, interested readers can visit the Analyst Stock Ratings page on Benzinga.

data.title: Utenos Trikotažas sees 30.7% revenue growth to Eur 15.9 million in 2025, with exports contributing to 80.7% of sales.
data.description: Throughout the first three quarters of 2025, Utenos Trikotažas, a part of the SBA textile group, experienced ongoing expansion with its revenue surging by 30.7% to reach Eur 15.9 million. The majority of the sales, amounting to 80.7%, came from exports.

data.title: Vesper Bio reports >95% increase in progranulin levels with lead candidate VES001 for frontotemporal degeneration.
data.description: During a recent Phase Ib/IIa study, VES001, the inaugural oral treatment under examination for FTD, was discovered to result in a mean increase of over 95% in progranulin levels in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) in comparison to the baseline. The topline findings of the study suggest that VES001 has the capability to restore progranulin levels in individuals experiencing a deficiency of this crucial protein due to genetic factors.

data.title: Zoomlion celebrates World Cities Day 2025 by backing urban development, with focus on smart cities.
data.description: In Changsha, China, Zoomlion Heavy Industry Science & Technology Co., Ltd. (stock symbol: 1157.HK) is commemorating World Cities Day 2025 by reaffirming its commitment to sustainable urban development, interconnected transportation, and the advancement of smart cities.
